import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.9c730838:
df = pd.read_csv('../input/graduate-admissions/Admission_Predict.csv')
df = df.drop("Serial No.", axis=1) # Dropping unnecessary column
x = df.iloc[:, :-1].values # Independent Var x
y = df.iloc[:, -1].values  # Dependent Var y
source.00480dfc:
import pandas_profiling as pp
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
%matplotlib inline
source.6307f7b6: pp.ProfileReport(df, title = 'Pandas Profiling report of "Graduate Admission Chances" dataset')
source.2d44e373:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(x, y, test_size = 0.2, random_state = 0)
source.3a83063f:
# If the "chance of admit" is greater than "80" then the admission is confirmed means "1"
y_train = [1 if each > 0.8 else 0 for each in y_train]
# If the "chance of admit" is lower than "80" then the admission is not confirmed means "0"
y_test = [1 if each > 0.8 else 0 for each in y_test]
source.c64241a7:
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
classifier = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators = 100, random_state = 0)
classifier.fit(X_train, y_train)
